title: Welcome
sdk_landing_subtitle: Clone the TWK SDK, plug it into your web app, and start integrating with the TWK bridge in just a few steps.
sdk_landing_what_is_body: The TWK SDK is a small TypeScript wrapper and JavaScript bridge that securely connects your web application to the TWK native layer.
sdk_landing_what_is_item_1: Typed helper methods for common TWK capabilities (device info, user data, and more).
sdk_landing_what_is_item_2: Built-in HMAC signing and hashing for every request made from the web app to TWK.
sdk_landing_what_is_item_3: Simple configuration using TWKAPIBASE, SHAREDSECRET, and ENABLELOG on the host page.
sdk_landing_what_is_item_4: Framework-agnostic design that works with Angular, React, Vue, or plain JavaScript.
sdk_landing_quick_step_1: Clone or download the SDK repository from Bitbucket.
sdk_landing_quick_step_2: Copy twk-sdk.ts into your project source, and place twkhelper.js where it can be served as a static asset.
sdk_landing_quick_step_3: In your HTML host page, set TWKAPIBASE, SHAREDSECRET, and ENABLELOG before loading twkhelper.js.
sdk_landing_quick_step_4: Import TwkSdk, call TwkSdk.init(...) once at startup, then call SDK methods such as getDeviceInfo or getUserFullName.
sdk_landing_env_body: Your host application controls the API base URL and shared secret used to sign every request. Configure these globals before loading twkhelper.js so that all TWK calls are authenticated.
sdk_landing_appearance_body_1: The sample Angular integration shows how to read appearance and language from TWK.getDeviceInfo() and apply dark or light themes automatically.
sdk_landing_appearance_body_2: You can reuse this pattern in your own UI, or keep the SDK purely as a backend integration layer without any visual changes.
sdk_landing_keys_body: The TWK bridge exposes multiple helpers that you can call directly or through the TwkSdk wrapper, depending on how much control you need.
sdk_landing_why_title: Why this SDK for Tawakkalna mini-apps?
sdk_landing_why_body_1: Tawakkalna offers many services as mini-apps. The TWK SDK gives you a consistent, secure way to build those services without re-implementing the bridge logic in every project.
sdk_landing_why_body_2: By standardising the Webâ€“TWK integration, ELM developers can focus on the business flows and UI while the SDK handles signatures, headers, and device capabilities.
